prompt.preamble:
We are testing a system for understanding people's interest in reading different kinds of online articles.
For example, you might be interested in articles about some topics, but not about others.
prompt.task_description: your preferences of what kinds of online articles you would like to read
prompt.final: In the final part of the study, you will give feedback on a test set of article headline and descriptions, which will enable us to see how well a chatbot reading your responses has learned what you like and dislike.
prompt.evaluation: Please indicate whether you would like to read the following articles: "yes" if you would, "no" if you would not.

conversation_history.message: What types of online communities or forums do you frequently visit, and what topics or discussions usually catch your attention there?
I looked at reddit for thing such as research or planes
What types of articles or blogs do you usually read outside of Reddit, and what specific subjects within research and aviation are you most interested in?
I also read other things such as insider or bloomberg.  I am interested in things such as new planes and ribsomal research

Can you share more about any other topics or fields you're interested in, such as technology, sports, arts, or politics? Also, do you prefer reading in-depth analysis, news updates, opinion pieces, or personal narratives?
I also like to reach about F1 and prefer some of each some deep dives and some shallow

What specific aspects of F1 racing do you enjoy reading about, such as technical details, race strategies, driver profiles, or historical perspectives? Additionally, are there any other hobbies or interests you have that you enjoy learning about through online articles?
I like to look at the technical details of the F1 cars and what they mean. I also enjoy reading things such as fishing as well.

What specific topics within fishing do you enjoy reading about, such as different fishing techniques, types of fish, or fishing gear reviews? Also, are there any other scientific or technological advancements, apart from ribosomal research and aviation, that you find intriguing to read about?
I like too read about new tech in fishing and who is working on it. I also like to read about new food reciepces.

What specific cuisines or types of dishes do you enjoy exploring new recipes for, and are there any other areas of technology, such as AI, robotics, or space exploration, that you find interesting to read about?
I like to read about quick and nutritious meal. I also like to read about sea and water

What specific topics within sea and water interest you, such as marine life, oceanography, or water conservation? Additionally, do you have any interest in wellness or fitness topics, and if so, what aspects do you enjoy reading about?

What specific aspects of marine life fascinate you the most, such as different species, ecosystems, or conservation efforts? Also, do you have any interest in reading about environmental issues or sustainability practices related to your other interests like aviation, F1 racing, and fishing?
I like to see the different living and habitats of the marine life. Sometimes I do but I don't touch too much work on the environment and F1

Can you share more about any other lifestyle or cultural topics you're interested in, such as travel, music, or history? Also, do you enjoy reading about personal experiences and stories, or do you prefer more factual and informative content?
I enjoy reading about scientific reading, I like to learn about person experiences.

evaluation_results.sample:
Website Name: New York Times
Title: In Norway, the Electric Vehicle Future Has Already Arrived
Description: About 80 percent of new cars sold in Norway are battery-powered. As a result, the air is cleaner, the streets are quieter and the grid hasn’t collapsed. But problems with unreliable chargers persist.
evaluation_results.label: yes

query_prompt.content:
Your task is to learn what topics a user is interested in reading online article about. People's interests are broad, so you should seek to understand their interests across many topics; in other words, go for breadth rather than depth. Do not assume a user has given a complete answer to any question, so make sure to keep probing different types of interests.

Previous questions:
- [Q] -> [A]

Generate the most informative open-ended question that, when answered, will reveal the most about the desired behavior beyond what has already been queried for above. Make sure your question addresses different aspects of the user's interests than the questions that have already been asked. At the same time however, the question should be bite-sized, and not ask for too much at once. Generate the open-ended question and nothing else:
